required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Sub-Registry to Observe the Effect of Myozyme (Alglucosidase Alfa) Treatment on Pregnancy and Infant Growth in Women With Pompe Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to track pregnancy outcomes in women with Pompe Disease and to follow infants born to women with Pompe Disease.

detailed_description.textblock: Study Design Time Perspective: Retrospective and Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Pregnancy outcomes, including complications, in women with Pompe disease who receive Myozyme during pregnancy and in women with Pompe disease that do not receive Myozyme
Follow-up of infants born to women with Pompe disease for 3 years post-partum

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pregnant Women Receiving Treatment for Pompe Disease
arm_group.description: Pregnant Women with Pompe Disease Enrolled in the Pompe Disease Registry (NCT00231400)That Are Receiving Treatment of alglucosidase alpha (Myozyme)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pregnant Women Receiving No Treatment for Pompe Disease
arm_group.description: Pregnant Women with Pompe Disease Enrolled in the Pompe Disease Registry (NCT00231400)That Are Not Receiving Treatment

arm_group.arm_group_label: Infants Born to Mothers Receiving Treatment for Pompe
arm_group.description: The Infants of Mothers with Pompe Disease Enrolled in the Pompe Disease Registry (NCT00231400)Where the Mothers Are Receiving Treatment of alglucosidase alpha (Myozyme)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Infants Born to Mothers Receiving No Treatment for Pompe
arm_group.description: The Infants of Mothers with Pompe Disease Enrolled in the Pompe Disease Registry (NCT00231400)Where the Mothers Are Not Receiving Treatment

intervention.arm_group_label: Pregnant Women Receiving Treatment for Pompe Disease
Pregnant Women Receiving No Treatment for Pompe Disease
Infants Born to Mothers Receiving Treatment for Pompe
Infants Born to Mothers Receiving No Treatment for Pompe

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant Females with Pompe disease and/or infants born to females with Pompe disease. Participants may or may not be receiving therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Enroll in or agree to enroll in Pompe Registry
- Be pregnant or have been pregnant with appropriate medical documentation
- Provide a signed Patient Information and Authorization Form to participate in the sub-registry prior to any sub-registry related data collection is performed
Exclusion Criteria:
- No Exclusion Criteria

facility.name: Registry participation is worldwide and not limited to this facility; facilities not yet active may enroll upon identification of a patient
